qas.question: Who was the subject of an early June 2013 front page story?
Who wrote the story on Tulisa Contostavlos?
What was the main allegation in The Sun's story on Contostavlos?

answers.text: that Tulisa introduced three film producers (actually Mahmood and two other Sun journalists) to a drug dealer and set up a £800 deal

qas.question: What did The Sun reporters make Contostavlos believe?

answers.text: that she was being considered for a role in an £8 million Bollywood film

qas.question: What was the title of the front page story on Contostavlos?

context: On 2 June 2013, The Sun on Sunday ran a front page story on singer-songwriter <a0_0>Tulisa Contostavlos<a0_0/>. The front page read: "<a4_0>Tulisa's cocaine deal shame<a4_0/>"; this story was written by The Sun On Sunday's undercover reporter <a1_0>Mahzer Mahmood<a1_0/>, who had previously worked for the News of the World. It was claimed <a2_0>that Tulisa introduced three film producers (actually Mahmood and two other Sun journalists) to a drug dealer and set up a £800 deal<a2_0/>. The subterfuge involved conning the singer into believing <a3_0>that she was being considered for a role in an £8 million Bollywood film<a3_0/>.
